A: This is about finding the seed of the mysterious "pack.png"image that minecraft uses. All of this started with a YouTube video made by SalC1

Q: Are you just trying random seeds until you find it?
A: Nope! That would actually take an impossible amount of time.

Q: Can we use the method they did with PewDiePie's seed?
A: Nope! They had more information than we did, and actually have people who actually did most of the work finding it in the Discord server right now!(Link below)
Maybe! But trying lots of different seeds is really just a waste of time sadly :(

Q: How can I help crack the seed
A: Unless you have access to enterprise-grade computing hardware, then you can't.
The image minecraft used for the default texture pack in the texturepack selection screen.

Q: What information could you extract from the image?
A: player position can be determined through cloud pattern and axis could be determined through the orientation of the water texture
CactusDuper(With lots of help from the community <3)!

Q: Do you have enough processing power? I could rent out stuff from X
A: Yes, we have plenty of processing power. To be exact, 2-6 NVIDIA DGX-2 Supercomputers.

Q: What's that number exactly? A billion?

A: Yes! We'd love your help! The Discord is at the very bottom. Please make sure to read all of the FAQ and read the rules channel when you join.
